section: This Services Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into on October 1, 2019 and is made effective as of November 1, 2019 (the "Effective Date"),
explanation: The agreement is entered into on October 1, 2019, but is not effective until November 1, 2019. There may be some action to be taken between the dates of entering in and when it is effective, but there is nothing in the text to suggest that. This is ambiguous.

section: Recipient may freely assign its rights under this Agreement to receive the Services to any of its affiliates.
explanation: While Recipient may assign their rights, Provider is not allowed to assign, delegate or otherwise transfer either this Agreement or any of its rights, interests, or obligations hereunder without the prior written approval of Recipient, making it uneven.

section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: This section states that the agreement is effective as of the Effective Date which creates a structural flaw. Effective date should not be written again. Furthermore, the document does not make sense because the effective date of the agreement is listed as November 1, 2019, but this agreement will terminate on December 31, 2020.
